dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: 1   On a DEEP...DEEP...DARKNESS. A FLICKER. Of LIGHT. Off to the side. Just barely. Noticeable. ORANGE...YELLOW...as we realise...It's FIRE.. A SOUND.   Something SHATTERING... Then. A DISEMBODIED VOICE. Muted. We can't quite make out What it's saying. As it gets LOUDER. And LOUDER. When we finally. Understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are in danger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEL SPOONER'S FACE.    His eyes, snapping open.   His fac covered in sweat. PULL BACK to REVEAL him lying in bed. Sheets, tangled aro his legs. Alarm clock, playing something relentlessly cheerful. Spooner slaps it off. Sits up. Wincing. Bends his RIGHT ARM. Stiff. He reaches for a BOTTLE OF PILLS. Shakes out couple and swallows them. Trying to forget. That dream. You are in danger... He rubs his hands over his face. Gets out of bed. His apartment, basic. Unremarkable. Bearing the signs of someone who lives alone. Shades drawn. A little messy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner turns his face into the jet of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaves with a razor.    Using his left hand.   Knicks the of his chin. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stares down at the single egg in a saucepan.      Waiting to boil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads down the hallway. Looping a knotted tie around his neck. Kicks some neglected mail from the door and reaches for the handle. Takes a deep breath and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...steps outside. Into the flow of COMMUTERS heading for elevated trains. Elbow to elbow. A river of humanity. Spooner moves along, like everyone else. Suddenly. His shoulders tense. That feeling at the back of his neck. He turns and sees... A ROBOT. Just behind him. Humanoid in design, but still obviously a machine. Metal and synthetic casings covering hydraulic muscles. The thing senses his stare. Looks up with a muted WHIR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (metallic voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good day, sir... Spooner. Speeds up his pace.     Weaving through the crow lose the robot. We now realise this is THE FUTURE. Towering apartment buildings block the sun. The street packed with traffic. PEDESTRIANS wearing their computers like form-fitting portable offices. Spooner throws a look at his surroundin Up high an INDUSTRIAL ROBOT rolls down the side of a buil cleaning windows. A WORK CREW of oddly-shaped RUBE GOLDBERG ROBOTS efficien repairs the street. No human supervision. A ROBOTIC CLEAN-UP CREW. Lumbering along the sidewalk. Scrubbing, sweeping. Emptying trash... Humanoid ROBOTS dotting the crowd. Following their owners Walking slowly, deliberately. Carrying boxes. Groceries. Briefcases. Stamped on all the ROBOTS' SIDES, a LOGO:   III LAWS SAFE Spooner stops to wait at a light with other PEDESTRIANS. Directly in front of him, a LITTLE GIRL clutches her fath neck. She smiles big at Spooner. Front teeth missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. But it's not her father. It's her ROBOT CARETAKER.    The robot turns. Looks at the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not allowed to talk to strangers. Spooner, disgusted.   Has had enough.   He steps off the Just as... THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL swivels around.   Training its large digital EYE on him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please return to the sidewalk. Spooner dodges several cars on his way across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please return to the sidewalk... The traffic signal, tracking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are in violation of city ordinance 14-B726... Spooner throws up his hand. Flipping it the bird just as SNAP! It takes his picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner stepping onto a sleek, densely packed TRAIN. Look down at his feet. A trampled flyer on the ground. From th Anti-Robot League: METAL MONSTERS SECRET FACTORY REVEALED A Robot gets up. To offer him his seat. Spooner. Turns hi back on him as we PULL BACK from the window to REVEAL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRAIN hurtling toward DOWNTOWN. Soaring, gravity-defy OFFICE BUILDINGS dominate the skyline. Older buildings wedged among the new. All protected by huge glass and ste shields. As we get closer congested roads and freeways begin to disappear below ground into a series of subterranean tunn The "old" streets have become huge, spacious plazas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner moves with the CROWD towards the doors of the agi Police Headquarters. Modern additions have been made to t original facade -- creating an ungainly architectural mes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast open plan situation room lined on one side by a se of glass-enclosed rooms. On the other side a GIANT SCREEN with real time video of various streets and buildings. Spooner arrives at his desk. Unlike the others, it's a me A slender computer screen curving along the front of it. Several electronic messages say the same thing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever heard the phrase "lead by example?" Spooner looks up. LIEUTENANT JOHN BERGIN stands in front his desk, holding up a CITATION with a photo of Spooner giving that traffic signal the finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't ring a bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Spooner's badge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on your badge. Spooner takes the citation.   Drops it into a drawer fill with about fifty others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The traffic division filed an official complaint this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The traffic division is a machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know there's going to be an adjustment period, Del...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll send them a letter of apology. Maybe some flowers. A box of chocolates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUST THEN Spooner's phone RINGS.   He throws Bergin a loo Then snatches up the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner, homicide.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A sprawling glass and metal complex covering many city blocks. The entrance is a large plaza filled with PEOPLE ROBOTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elevator opens with a whoosh. Spooner steps out into a featureless corridor. His footsteps, echoing. He stops at set of OPPOSING DOORS. Looks over at one, when the other suddenly OPENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warm, mahogany-paneled room. In sharp contrast to the c metal space outside. Spooner steps inside. At the end of long conference table sits an OLD MAN. Sparkling blue eye Old-fashioned suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, there. Please come in. Spooner hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. You can sit.     Sit. Spooner doesn't.   Looks around the room. The Old Man lif up a coffee pot.   Pours some coffee into a single cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interested)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're offering me a cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But you are to say, "No, thank you." Spooner nods a little. The Old Man raises the coffee to h lips, but doesn't take a sip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee? SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    Thank you. OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish. The Old Man takes a sip. He doesn't move. There is no movement except for a whisper of steam rising from the co pot. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to tell me something about Dr. Hogenmiller? About his death? The Old Man smiles. OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to tell you that his death was not a suicide. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why do you say that? OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?   Because I want you to know it. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that. But what specifically leads you to believe that he didn't commit suicide? OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers) Nothing specifically. Spooner shifts his weight.   Agitated. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under normal circumstances that wouldn't be enough to get you a homicide investigation. OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is not "normal circumstances," is it, Detective Spooner? SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    It isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you will find out who killed Dr. Hogenmiller, yes? And then you will tell me. Spooner's losing his patience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were murdered, Doctor, I'll find out. And you'll be the first to know..... JUST THEN the HOLOGRAM of DR. HOGENMILLER vanishes in a b of LIGHT, as does the table, the coffee pot, and the conference room. Spooner, suddenly finds himself standing front of a LARGE VIEW SCREEN inside a SMALL METAL CHAMBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner steps out into the hallway and into...AN ESCORT ROBOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please follow me. Spooner. Reluctantly starts to follow it.     Passes anot doorway. POLICE TAPE stretched across it.     Catches a b glimpse of... DR. HEINRICH HOGENMILLER'S BODY. Splayed out across the floor. Surrounded by CRIME SCENE TECHNICIANS. He pauses. Taking in the scene. Then continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two large doors emblazoned with the U.S. ROBOTICS LOGO op automatically. Inside, an enormous glass-enclosed boardro looking out over the entire complex. Spooner walks through the doorway. His escort robot trail behind him. An army of corporate types sit around a conference table. Young. Energetic. You can practically feel the brains and ambition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usually I ask who's in charge... Spooner's eyes lock with a MAN sitting at the head of the table. 60s, handsome, charismatic. Dr. LANCE ROBERTSON, founder and CEO of U.S. Robotics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But everyone knows you, Dr. Robertson. Robertson smiles.   Pretends to instruct his people. ROBERTSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me to cut back on my talk show appearances. LAUGHTER. ROBERTSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to U.S. Robotics, Detective. I regret you're not visiting us under more pleasant circumstances. Allow me to introduce Mr. Aronson, our head of Legal Affairs. A prematurely graying MAN leaning against the wall.    No hello. ROBERTSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the gentleman to my right is Dr. Alfred Lanning, Director of Research. Alfred Lanning, only one there in a tie.   Nods. ROBERTSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be available to answer any questions you might have during your investigation. You'll understand how anxious we are to resolve this matter -- especially before the press gets wind of it. There are some anti-robot sentiments out there as you know, Detective, and we're not eager to stir them up. So. Where would you like to begin? SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can begin with whether or not the old man put a gun to his head and pulled the trigger. A palpable wave of tension shoots through the group. ARONSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to answer that, Dr. Robertson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robertson waves him off. ROBERTSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan?   Perhaps you can assist us here? Everyone looks down at the other end of the table. A BEAT Then an attractive young WOMAN gets to her feet. SUSAN CALVIN. Hair tucked behind her ears. Looking at everyone but Spooner. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Hogenmiller was a schizoid personality who generally eschewed social relationships. Rejecting people in favor of solitary activities involving machines. He spent almost all his time at the lab here or at his lab at home. As a result he was highly susceptible to depression. ROBERTSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Calvin is our Chief Psychologist. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that was your diagnosis, why didn't you see this coming? Calvin turns. Finally meeting Spooner's eye.      As if t answer's obvious. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is U.S. Robotics, Detective. Seventy-five percent of our employees fit that description. LANNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interceding) You'll have to excuse the doctor. We're all a little on edge. This has been a difficult and emotional morning. Spooner throws a look around the room.   Then back at Cal SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    I can see you're all broken up. Robertson responds to Spooner's skepticism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Hogenmiller was at my side from the very beginnings of this company. We developed the "Three Laws of Robotics" together. But these days science is a young man's game. By the time you hit thirty your best years are behind you. Some of us are kicked upstairs. Others I'm afraid aren't so lucky. Robertson stands.   Meeting over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Hogenmiller took his own life. I trust you will come to the same swift conclusion, Detective. Dr. Lanning will make himself available if you have any further questions. Spooner looks over at Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want her to help me. Calvin, unhappy with this arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not really my department...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan would be happy to assist you. And with a gesture, Robertson dismisses everyone. People start getting up, gathering up, filing out. Susan Calvin. The last one to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner and Calvin, heading down the same hallway he was before. Catch sight of a couple ROBOT TECHNICIANS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Christ...Toasters... As they duck under the police tape and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...enter Hogenmiller's lab. Alive with activity. CRIME

dialogues.speaker: SCENE TECHNICIANS, MOBILE ANALYSIS UNITS. LIGHT SCANS,
dialogues.text: running across... HOGENMILLER'S LIFELESS FACE.   Black gun powder.   Fannin around his contorted lips. Spooner. Throws a look around the lab: ROBOTS. Everywhere Mostly incomplete. TORSOS. ARMS. LEGS. Dangling from the ceiling. A SERGEANT. Passes them by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say the price's gonna come down a lot next year. Kinda cool, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How cool will it be when one takes your job? Spooner.   Pushing past him.   His eyes.   Darting around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything alright, Detective?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. This is just how I like my robots -- in pieces. As they approach Hogenmiller's body, the lead CRIME SCENE INVESTIGATOR, BALDEZ, gets up to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spooner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe it, man? U.S. Robotics. I didn't think I'd ever see the inside of this building. Hands Spooner, a plasma clipboard.   Spooner signs it, awkwardly. With his LEFT HAND...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the run-down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heinrich Hogenmiller, sixty-four years old. Weapon a small caliber .22, registered in his name. Looks like he walked in, locked the door, and snuffed himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner.   Cocking his head to look at Hogenmiller's face SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know someone who disagrees with you. BALDEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Spooner.   Stands.   Pointing down at Hogenmiller. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him. And steps over the body, leaving a confused Baldez. Stepping deeper, into the lab. Calvin. Following. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spoke to a dead man today.   Want to tell me about that? CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Hogenmiller's hologram took his appointments. Attended staff meetings. He hated corporate life. The hologram enabled him to focus on his work. It's just a device, Detective. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A device that called the police. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the gunshot would've triggered a 911. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the call came directly to me. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking about a mechanism designed by Hogenmiller to say provocative things. To irritate and confound his colleagues. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's what you think it is? CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but this whole investigation is the result of a dead man's toy messing with your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass half a robot, hanging from a hook. Spooner curl his lip. Swivels the robot's head so it's not looking at him. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the last time any of you actually spoke to Hogenmiller? I mean human to human? CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't say. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a guess. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't guess, Detective. But if pressed, I would reason it had been a considerable length of time. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How well did you know him? Calvin.   Gently swivels the robot's head back to where i been. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not well. But I admired his work tremendously. Spooner. Studies her for a beat. Then turns back to the body. Two CORONERS entering with a high-tech body box. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get the whole "mad scientist" thing. Hogenmiller was past his prime. Isolated. Eccentric. He enters a room. Locks the door and is found minutes later with a bullet fired through his mouth into his brain. Everything about this case says suicide. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't sound convinced. The coroners.   Start loading the body into the box. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even people who live a life of logic and precision rarely arrange their deaths so perfectly. (turning to her) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPOONER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What all this is missing -- is personality... As he starts for the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have 24 hour surveillance?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...They head out into the hallway.    A MECHANICAL DOOR G rolling into place behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's company policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see the tapes. Calvin. Hurrying to keep up with him. This is hardly how she wanted to spend her morning. Calls out into the air..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor! At the end of the corridor, near the elevator, a BRIGHT CIRCLE appears. Hovering just in front of the wall. Two small slits grow into ROUND BLACK EYES...and a thin mouth expands into an ENORMOUS SMILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective, meet Victor. Our building's supercomputer. He's the checks and balances of U.S.R. (to Victor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor, Detective Spooner's heading up the investigation into the death of Dr. Hogenmiller. Victor smiles big.   Spooner, furrows his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like a very...happy computer. Victor responds in a GENTLE MALE VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. That's very kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detective needs to see our security tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors immediately OPEN.   They step inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner and Calvin descend. Victor floats on the wall and smiles wide. Spooner looks back at it. With a frown. The elevator stops, the doors open.    A ROBOT steps on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good day, Dr. Calvin.   Good day, sir. Spooner's jaw. Clenches. Staring at the Robot.       It s the stare. Turns back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I be of service to you, sir? Spooner. Breaks the stare.     Ignoring the Robot.   Calv Looks over at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to answer him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't talk to my refrigerator, either. Calvin folds her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get the distinct feeling you're one of those people, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those who don't appreciate the work we do here at U.S.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You people do what you do. Then it's up to the rest of us to make sense out of the world we wake up in. As the elevator doors open on to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soaring lobby. The centerpiece is a five-story STATUE o ROBOT, arms outstretched in approximation of Da Vinci's S of Man. Robot workers more numerous than humans. They are sleeker. Finer. More advanced than those in the outside world. Calvin and Spooner head across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this company started we were manufacturing three robots a week. Now look at us. Today's children will never know a world without robots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets are filled with unemployed humans who aren't exactly thrilled with that idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our robotic systems maintain factory inventories, regulate street traffic -- even run the family home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving people to do what, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving people to engage in higher pursuits that make life worth living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happens when something goes wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our system's never wrong. As they walk through the crowd, we hear the quiet WHIR of robot heads as they turn in succession to watch Spooner p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner and Calvin enter the MAINFRAME of U.S. Robotics. This is the nerve center of the whole operation. Walls li with COMPUTERS, SCREENS, and thousands of CONTROLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Victor's home. VICTOR appears on a wall-sized SCREEN broken up into beeh like components. VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will now play you the last thirty- two seconds of Dr. Hogenmiller's life. AS WE WATCH THE SCREENS. The elevator opens and DOCTOR HOGENMILLER steps into the metal corridor. In countless ANGLES. High, low, close-up, wide. Hogenmiller's face composed but tight. Spooner watches the lab doors open to admit him.   Hogenm steps in. The doors slide closed behind him. Nothing for a few moments. Then a muffled GUNSHOT. Calvin jumps, startled. That's it. The cameras, still trained on the corridor. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the tape from inside? VICTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Hogenmiller did not permit cameras to observe him while working. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was only within the last year. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we can throw paranoia into the mix. (to Victor) Fast-forward. A hundred-plus screens all FAST-FORWARD. POLICE OFFICERS appear and force open the doors. Now TECHNICIANS appear and rush through in a blur... CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um.   I hate to be a stickler... On screen, we see Spooner and Calvin enter the lab. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't killers usually have to enter and exit the scene of a crime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the recording. Spooner turns away from the footage.   Stares at Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do, Doctor. Unless they've always been there -- and never left. Calvin looks at him.   Trying to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think the murderer was in the lab the entire time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm right, it's still there... Spooner turns back to the screens. The IMAGE paused at th exact moment the MECHANICAL GUARD rolled in front of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just locked it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STEEL ARMS of the ROBOTIC GUARD retract with a CLANG. laboratory doors slide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner and Calvin step inside. It's dark. Quiet. Police and technicians long gone. Silhouettes of hanging limbs. Eyeless heads. Clumps of wire and metal. The LIGHTS, flicker on. Calvin sees Spooner reaching into his coat with his left hand. Pulling out a GUN. Reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A robot cannot harm a human being, Detective. The First Law of Robotics forbids it. And we hard- wire the Three Laws into every model. Without exception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I saw the commercial. Spooner steps deeper into the lab. Eyes scanning. Twistin To avoid touching any robot parts. Passes a MAZE holding METAL INSECT. SUDDENLY. The bug WHIRS to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner startles. As the metal bug scurries through the corridors. Clamps his hand down on it. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if a robot was given a direct order to kill? CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Second Law of Robotics would prevent it. A robot must obey an order only if it does not conflict with the first law. Spooner approaches a MOUND of ROBOT PARTS. Arms and legs. Half torsos. All tossed haphazardly onto the pile. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a robot can defend itself. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only when that action doesn't conflict with the First or Second Laws. This is the Third Law of Robotics. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you know what they say -- Laws are made to be broken. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not these laws. Spooner. Starts nudging the pile with his shoe.   Calvin, growing impatient... CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not hearing me, Detective. There's nothing here...

dialogues.speaker: WHEN SUDDENLY

dialogues.text: Robotics, was killed yesterday morning by a robot. While there has been no official response from the company, police sources have confirmed that a robot is being held as "evidence..." Bergin grimaces.   This is not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner stares at his reflection in a large MIRROR.     T a control and the mirror becomes a WINDOW onto... A HOLDING CELL. The Robot Suspect sits at the table. Shackled to the chair. Staring at the table top. BERGIN steps up beside Spooner.   Looks through the glass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell if it's not moving because it's trying to psych us out, or because it's just a machine. Or both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orders are nobody steps into that room `til Lanning and his attorneys get here. Spooner.   Throws him a look.   Bergin, his loyalties tor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner enters. Pulls out a chair and drags it far from t table. He's been jumped too many times by this machine. Four mounted cameras WHIR to life.     The Robot.   Perfe still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Identify. The Robot tilts its head with a muted WHIR.     As if it understand him. Spooner. Disdainful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are an NS-2 Nestor-class robot. Your primary function is to perform the tasks assigned to you. Identify. THE ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am an NS-2 Nestor-class robot. My primary function -- SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Cancel. Perform task. Spooner wings a FILE onto the table. It comes to a stop n the Robot. The Robot, lifts one of its hands. Gently resting its metal fingers on top of the file. Then opens A stack of PICTURES.     HOGENMILLER'S CORPSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Describe. The Robot's emotionless face studies the grim images. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have over 10,000 words stored in your memory. One third of those are adjectives. Describe. Nothing. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't I take a crack? Heinrich Hogenmiller, your creator. With a bullet in his brain. A bullet you put there. The Robot.   Looks up at Spooner. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold-blooded murder is a pretty new trick for a robot, don't you think? Answer. The Robot slowly closes the file and slides it back acros the table. Spooner. Crosses his arms. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're stonewalling me. Maybe you're sitting there right now thinking, "This guy's a complete asshole." That it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.   Am I right? THE ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You are right.      You are a complete asshole. And for a moment, Spooner is shocked. You can see it in h eyes. He sits back in his chair. Forcing a tight smile. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I guess that's a start. Now maybe you can tell me what you were doing hiding five feet away from Hogenmiller's corpse? THE ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was frightened. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frightened. Why do you suppose Dr. Hogenmiller would create a robot that could simulate fear? THE ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't seem like a very useful thing for a robot to have. THE ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't want my toaster to be frightened. Or my vacuum cleaner -- SUDDENLY the Robot SLAMS its metal hands down on the tabl THE ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: I DON'T KNOW
dialogues.text: Spooner flinches.   Slightly. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you can simulate other emotional states. I think that one's called "anger." Have you ever simulated anger before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Robot doesn't respond. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me, robot. THE ROBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Sonny. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) So we're naming you now. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Hogenmiller would make me sleep. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean he'd turn you off. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you didn't like being turned off. So one day you decided to stop him. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found his gun, pointed it at his head. And pulled the trigger. Sonny shakes his head.    Faster and faster.   Getting up SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put a bullet in the brain of the man who made you. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!    I could never hurt anyone! SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you tried to hurt me.    You took a shot at me. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My aim is perfect. If I'd wanted to hit you, I would have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner's expression hardens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would the man who wrote the Laws of Robotics build a machine that violates them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Laws say I can protect my own existence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if that protection doesn't harm a human being. A short pause.   Sonny.   Tilts his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't seem fair, does it? Spooner. Stares at him. Just as...THE DOOR SWINGS OPEN. Bergin enters. Sticks his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you outside. Spooner.   Not wanting to go.   Not wanting to stay.   Ge up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective. He stops. Turns back to the Robot.      It looks up at hi a moment -- so human...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the only one in the room. If you didn't, who did? He turns and heads out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bergin closes the door.   To Spooner:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're being blind-sided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner and Bergin, head into a small COURTROOM off the m squad room. Lanning is huddled with Aronson and a half-do other COMPANY LAWYERS. Spooner's jaw tenses. As he watches Toller emerge from th clutch. Shaking hands. Slapping backs. Strolls over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got Judge Drexel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hearing is called to order!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS A LARGE SCREEN. BLIPS on behind them. The two opposing sides, assemble before it. JUDGE DREXEL, still in his pajamas and robe. An NS-2 ROBOT. Leaning in to serve him cup of tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Statements, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aronson.    Standing at a glass podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, the State is treating the robot as a defendant. But in fact it is a piece of property. Property belonging to U.S. Robotics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toller.    Arm resting on his podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This robot has been implicated in the death of a human being, Your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which places the incident firmly within the realm of an industrial accident. Or is the State going to argue this case s a homicide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.   Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner.    Pointing a finger at the U.S. Robotics group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their machine shot and killed a man! Toller.    Shoots him a look.     Just as Lanning speaks LANNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's actually no concrete evidence that points to that conclusion, Your Honor... Spooner.    Throws up his arms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?... LANNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we recognise that this robot is an aberration. And in the interest of public safety, U.S. Robotics proposes that it be destroyed immediately. No one expected this.    Least of all Spooner.    He turn Toller. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't let them destroy evidence in an ongoing investigation! TOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure you even have an investigation any more. JUST THEN the door opens.    Everyone turns as Calvin ent Spooner looks surprised. ARONSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, I'd like to call our company robo-psychologist to the stand. JUDGE DREXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. Calvin crosses to the podium. A SPEAKER asking: Doyousweartotellthetruththewholetruthandnothingbutthetrut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Calvin, please tell us what conclusions you've reached after having observed the robot in action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a design flaw in the robot. Its programming is advanced, but unstable, leaving the Three Laws in a grave imbalance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your expert opinion, what measures should be taken regarding the device?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin.    Staring straight ahead.   Avoiding Spooner's e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robot must be destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner can't believe what he's just heard. About to spea up when Toller grabs his arm. Squeezing it. Hard. Judge Drexel has heard enough.    Decides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robot in question will be transferred to a U.S. Robotics facility where it can be properly examined to ensure an imbalance of this sort never occurs again. No one goes near it except qualified U.S.R. personnel. When the examination is complete, the robot is to be destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starts getting up from his chair.    Already done with th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hearing is adjourned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BURST of CONVERSATION as the screen BLIPS off. The U.S. camp, looking especially pleased. Spooner. Catching Calvin's eye briefly. As Lanning leads her towards the ex his hand on her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner.    Trotting down the front steps of the Police Station.    Pissed. His cell phone BLEATS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're making me turn over all the evidence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BALDEZ. Standing in his crime lab. Behind him, THREE- DIMENSIONAL PROJECTIONS of DEAD BODIES. Hovering in the precise positions they were found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the great American cover- up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to tell you something I found before they suck it all up into their computer. Walks over to the projection of HOGENMILLER'S BODY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner. Crossing the Plaza. Sees LANNING, ARONSON, and CALVIN walking ahead of him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are bruises on Hogenmiller's wrists...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's natural. There was a struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not getting me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baldez.   Studying the projection's wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both wrists. I 14-ed them -- They were inflicted at the same time the shot was fired...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner's pace.    Slows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUST THEN.    A faint BLIP.   On the line.   Spooner.   R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baldez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else is on the line? (nothing) I said who's there?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. He looks up. Aronson, Lanning and Calvin. Headin down a plaza EXIT. Aronson. Throwing a look over his shoulder. Spooner.     Hangs up his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Sonny being escorted down a corridor by Toller, Bergin and a number of heavily-armed OFFICERS. He's bound with high-tech SHACKLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny and his police entourage emerge from the elevator i an underground car park. Spooner. Waiting for them. Heads over. Toller. Holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case is closed, Spooner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes past him.     Falling into step beside Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't expect to see you again, Detective...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to help me clear something up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do my best. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scientist builds a robot that acts like a man. More like a man than any robot ever before. It shoots him and U.S. Robotics calls it a failure. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you call it? SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stunning success. (beat) You were there, Robot.    What am I missing? SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start simulating ignorance. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not simulating ignorance, Detective. I'm experiencing it.       I was asleep. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you were shut down. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I was asleep. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robots don't sleep. Human beings sleep. Understand? Dogs sleep. You're a machine. An imitation. An illusion of life. Can a robot write a symphony? Can a robot take a blank canvas and paint a masterpiece? A pause.   Then the muted WHIR as Sonny turns to him. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do either of those things? Spooner. Momentarily stumped. As a VAN from U.S. ROBOTICS pulls up. The back door dropping open. An ENGINEER motion to the Robot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENGINEER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step forward. Enter. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to destroy me, aren't they? Spooner.   Watching him step into the van. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Sonny sits down. With an almost human melancholy.   The Engineers, securing him in place. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor was right. He told me everything was going to change.... The Engineers start to close the doors. But Spooner reach out to stop them. Sonny. Looks over at him. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's changing already... (beat) Can't you feel it? As CLANG! The van door CLOSES. Spooner, stepping back. Something. Just not right. Lieutenant Bergin comes up beside him. LT. BERGIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be happy. That's one less robot in the world. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to destroy the most advanced robot in the world, John. That doesn't strike you as odd? LT. BERGIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killer robots are bad for business. Even your friend Dr. Calvin said so. (slaps him on the back) Come on. You solved the case. Give yourself a break. Spooner looks at him.   There's no way he's giving himsel break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner driving. A small TELEVISION above the windshield. LANCE ROBERTSON holding a PRESS CONFERENCE outside U.S. Robotics...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I just want to assure you that this was an isolated incident. The prototype is now in custody -- and scheduled for destruction. Your robots are perfectly safe. There is no cause for alarm... Spooner's lip curls. Eyes flicking to a GPS display on th dashboard. A TOPOGRAPHICAL MAP pinpointing HOGENMILLER'S HOUSE. The CURSOR. Directing him to turn up...

dialogues.speaker: A STEEP DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: Narrow. Out of the way. Spooner's brow furrows.     As he hears a faraway RUMBLING SOUND...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Hogenmiller's house. Small. Simple. Built on a huge rock promontory overlooking the city. Three DEMOLITION ROBOTS rolling towards it. Huge, mashing, sporting massiv HYDRAULIC POUNDERS. Spooner's CAR. SCREECHES to a stop. He jumps out. Races over to the nearest machine. Looking around -- no people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Robot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! A SCREEN. Blinks to life on the hulking chassis.    A disembodied VOICE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demolition ordered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who authorised this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demolition ordered... Spooner reaches into his coat.    Pulling out his POLICE Scans it over the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Override. This is police business. Vacate the premises immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affirmative. The screen. Blinks off.     Spooner.   Eyeing it.   Turns heads for the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner pushes the door open. Stepping over the police ta Inside, the main room is spare, untidy. Cups of cold COFF littering surfaces. A COT, in the corner. On the walls, crooked CERTIFICATES. Heinrich Hogenmiller' name written out in academic script. Advanced Degrees in study of Robotics, Physics, Chemistry, Neurology, Ethics. AWARD on the mantelpiece. A silver NS-2. Tarnished. Spooner. Opening up a couple drawers of a side table. Jumbles of papers. Clippings. Old text books. Then a PHOTOGRAPH -- HOGENMILLER AND CALVIN. Standing arm-in-arm Spooner furrows his brow. WHEN SOMETHING SUDDENLY RUBS against his leg. He startles Looks down: a CAT. Lonely. Standing next to its automatic feeder. Spooner pockets the picture. Starts heading down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The hallway. Starts noticing. All over the walls: handwriting. EQUATIONS. Scrawled in white pencil. The rantings. Of a genius. Glowing. In the sporadic shadows. Spooner.   Following the equations.    Down into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The back room. Covered. In writing. Walls, floors, ceiling. Drawings. Of ROBOTS, of MEN, side by side. In th corner, a COMPUTER. A line of CABINETS - DATA STORAGE. Spooner, curious. Heads over to one of the cabinets. Take a device out of his pocket and CLAMPS it over the KEYPAD. The device blinks RED. Then GREEN. The drawer, slides out LINED. With flat metal objects. Shiny. Thin.          Wit on them. Spooner. Reaches for one when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! Something POUNDS the outside of the room.    Spoone Grabs onto the cabinet... BOOM! On the other side. Objects. Flying off table-tops. A CRACK spidering along the wall. Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt! BOOM! VIBRATIONS, tearing through the room.     More CRAC Spreading... BOOM! The SOUND, horrifying. Spooner stumbles back. CABINET. Crashing down on his leg. He CRIES OUT... BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! The house. Getting pummeled.        Chu ceiling. Raining down. GLASS...exploding... Relentless BOOMING! Spooner...dragging his legs from unde the cabinet. Scrambling for purchase as... THE FLOOR...begins to tilt...the TILES...snapping up...ricocheting...around the room...as another cabinet.. CRASHES to the ground...crumpling... Spooner.   Spinning around.   Looking for some kind of ex BOOM! The corner of the room...coming in on itself...the floor...listing even more...like a ship... Spooner...turning to CLAW his way up to the cracked doorway...WHEN... SOMETHING catches his eye. In the bottom drawer. Of a crumpled CABINET. One of those flat metal plates. He can just read what it says: S.O.N.N.Y.... Spooner...flings his arm back...reaching for the plate... snaps it up...JUST AS... BOOM! A HYDRAULIC POUNDER SMASHES through the wall...inch from his head...OUTSIDE LIGHT...pouring in... Spooner scurries for the doorway...tumbling out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...into the HALLWAY. Sideways. Trammeled plaster. BOOM! Another POUNDER...crashing down from above. Spooner. Timi it...rolling...BOOM!...just under the next pounding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scampering up...towards some LIGHT...BOOM!...the POUNDER...right on his heels...he clambers...closer... closer...when...he hears...MEOWING...looks back...the CAT...scared out of its wits...BOOM!...the POUNDER CRASHI in...Spooner...just manages...to scoop up the cat...just BOOM!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He pours them out into the open. The POUNDERS. Going a the house like hyenas at a corpse. Roof tiles, beams, plaster, flooring. SNAPPING and CRACKING as Spooner and t cat skitter down the carnage. Heart pounding, breath jagged, face bloodied, Spooner scrambles away from the POUNDERS. Their bodies GLEAMING i the dusk sun. The III Laws Safe logo, splashed along thei sides... Spooner.   Drops the cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spooner. POUNDS on the door. It opens. Calvin. Standing there in her bathrobe. Shocked at his appearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective! What happened to you?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of your beloved robots just tried to kill me... He pushes past her.   Into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...her condo.   Spartan.    Unadorned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That's impossible.      You know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I know is a demolition crew started tearing down Hogenmiller's house while I was still inside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they didn't realise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I scanned my badge before I went in. They realised. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you must have done it wrong... SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you're hearing what I'm saying -- they tried to kill me. Spooner moves deeper into the apartment.   Everything. Automated. Computerised. Cold... SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something going on, here. Some kind of shift. Calvin laughs.   Can't believe what she's hearing. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how paranoid you sound? SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Now I'm being analysed by a robo-psychologist. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just want to find the flaws in the system. You're obsessed with it. You'll twist anything to fit your agenda. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you did in court today? How'd that fit your agenda, Doctor? He pulls out the PHOTO of Calvin and Hogenmiller. Calvin. Blanching at the sight of it. Spooner tosses it down. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me you hardly knew him. Want to try the truth this time? CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Detective, when you see someone you know well put a bullet through their brain, it makes you wonder if you ever really knew them at all. Calvin.   Looking down at the photo.   Swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (difficult for her) He was my mentor. No, more than that. A genius with an insight far beyond anyone in his field. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't sound like the washed-up old fool Robertson described. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he was starting to withdraw from everyone. Even me. Maybe...if I'd tried harder to reach him... (shakes her head) The Doctor was reckless when he created a robot potentially not bound by the Three Laws. He could have ruined everything we'd been working for. Spooner.    Locking eyes with her. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a motive for murder to me. Just not for the suspect we have in custody. Calvin. Blinks. Trying, to stick to her resolve. Heads over to the door. Spooner. Looking around the condo. SPOONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know there's not one thing in this apartment that looks like a human being lives here. No evidence of a life outside your work. Almost seems like you're afraid of people. Calvin.    Opening the door. CALVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of people, Detective. I just don't like them. Spooner. Looks at her.     Then heads out the door.   Cal SLAMS it behind him... The SOUND...of the SLAM...REVERBERATING...and we...

dialogues.speaker: ...A DEEP...DEEP...DARKNESS.
dialogues.text: A FLICKER. Of LIGHT. Off to the side. Just barely. Noticeable. ORANGE... YELLOW...as we realise...It's FIRE. Another SOUND...GLASS...SHATTERING...then a SIREN... faraway... The disembodied VOICE...coming out of nowhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are in danger... The FIRE...BUILDING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOGENMILLER
